Solar-powered lights: Solar panels can be installed on rooftops or walls to generate electricity that can power LED lights in the house or workplace. This would provide a sustainable and eco-friendly solution to the lack of sunlight.

Light: In the event of a solar eclipse or other natural disasters that cause the sun to disappear from view, it's important to have a backup plan. One option could be to stock up on flashlights or other portable lighting devices.

Solar-powered chargers: Solar-powered chargers can be used to charge mobile devices, laptops, and other electronic devices that rely on electricity. This would ensure that you have access to light and communication tools even if the sun didn't rise.
Artificial lighting: Installing artificial lighting in the house or workplace would provide a constant source of light. This could include overhead lights, lamps, or even LED strips.
Emergency kits: Keeping emergency kits stocked with flashlights, batteries, and other essentials would ensure that you have a backup plan in case of a power outage or other emergency.
